intro: Geissorhiza sulphurea, commonly known as the golden rain lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a tuberous root system that stores nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Geissorhiza sulphurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
